column4: hey guys - anything know anything about ssh X11 forwarding in hardy?
my hardy client machine doesn't seem to be doing it, even if I ssh -X
xterm Xt error: Can't open display:
if the connectivity isn't open both ways, I don't see how you can establish an ssh session
I'm sshing outbound through the firewall
can you reach the remote machine through the firewall?
yes. but that's an outbound connection
what you need to do is find out if ssh needs another open port for the incoming traffic... anybody got any ideas?
then if the remote machine has port 22 open, I guess you shouldn't have any trouble. unless I don't understand your problem
kick me, you wish to run an app on the remote host and have it show on your local machine? use -Y
but I'm also pretty sure it's -X
hwilde, hmmm... never needed to do the whole X display thing before. -Y usually suffices for me, I can run almost any app that way
did you check that X forwarding or something is enabled on the remote host? it could have an effect. Just guessing though
don't forget to quote $DISPLAY from your local shell with ' 's
